title: For whom the bell tolls
subject_group: Literature/American literature - Film and video adaptations
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/Resistance movements, War
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/Spain - History - Civil War, 1936-1939
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Academy awards (Motion pictures)
description: A romantic drama set in 1937, during the Spanish Civil War. Gary Cooper plays Robert Jordan, an American who has joined a guerilla group and has been assigned to blow-up a Falangist controlled Bridge. He meets and falls in love with a young woman, played by Ingrid Bergman, who joined the group after her brutal treatment at the hands of the enemy. Written by Dudley Nichols, based on the novel by Ernest Hemingway, which was unanimously voted the best novel of the year in 1941 by the Pulitzer Prize committee, but was vetoed for political reasons. Cast also includes Akim Tamiroff, Arturo de Cordova and Katina Paxinou. Music by Victor Young. Photography by Ray Rennahan. Edited by Sherman Todd and John F. Link. (Awards: Katina Paxinou, Oscar 1943, Best Supporting Actress)
